website_summaries.verdict: The Logitech Pop is a great device that feels like it just barely missed the mark. The solid design and cool integrations make it stand out, but the high price seems inappropriate for a button, no matter how smart it is.
pros: Between a solid design, plenty of integrations and impressive performance, the Logitech Pop stands out as a polished competitor in the smart button market
cons: The starter pack costs $100 (or £120), a bigger financial commitment than other smart buttons
Plus, setting up commands isn't as painless as it should be

customer_reviews.title: Not working with LIFX or HomeKit
customer_reviews.text: The buttons were working fine for a while with LIFX lights, and all the sudden it stopped working, I tried everything, factory reset on buttons and the bridge, and nothing. After resetting everything I can't even get it to work with IFTTT. I was also never able to get it to work with HomeKit since the beginning, but that wasn't a big deal for me.

customer_reviews.title: This was a worthwhile purchase, it could be improved upon for more control and modes.
customer_reviews.text: wish there where more click combinations and a dial, but I would buy this again, for sure. I can use my phone or my tv remote via irxevent to control my lights. However, my significant other and I most often use the pops. As you would guess, they are very convenient. If the pop also had a dial motion you could adjust infinite temperature or infinite brightens as well as three (or more) modes.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!  Makes life simple again..
customer_reviews.text: When home automation gets complex or a pain get a POP Home Switch! No more searching for a phone to turn lights on/off. No more reaching for light knobs on lamps just hit the POP switch. This really makes your life simple again! Sometimes it's the small things that make life great... customer_reviews.title: It has potential, but the shortcomings are too many to ignore
customer_reviews.text: The product has great potential, but its implementation rendered it useless to me. The dealbreaker for me is that even in advanced mode the app wouldn't let me select a given setting for my dimmers beyond just OFF and ON (which, in fact, was only 50% brightness). This happened both with Lutron dimmers and with dimmers connected to a Samsung SmartThings hub--both of which are "supported" systems. With great regret at its unfulfilled potential, I had no choice but to send it back to Amazon.

customer_reviews.title: Connects/works perfectly, but falls off wall.
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 Pops switches around my house. Programming, connectivity, and general daily use have not been a problem. The only small issue I have is the mounting tape. If you have matte/eggshell finish walls the sticky pad might not stick. You can remedy this with 3M command strips, or take the back off and screwing in the rubber backing into the wall itself. Neither is ideal, but they both work just fine. Again, the actual units themselves work flawlessly, no issues with button presses or connectivity.

I previously tried the flic switches which were unreliable, slow, and required a Bluetooth connection to a phone running the flic app. The pop switches communicate via a small hub which plugs into a power socket which I'm guessing is why they are so much more reliable. Maybe now my girlfriend will appreciate our smart home.

product_meta.title: Logitech Pop Add-On Home Switch for Pop Home Switch Starter Pack (Teal)
product_meta.description: Color:Teal| Style:Add-On SwitchLogitech pop add-on home switch gives everyone in the home even more access to basic control of multiple smart home devices. Set the scene with lighting presets, SONOS playlists, and more. Use three different commands to control smart home devices-individually or in groups-or turn harmony activities on or off. Requires pop home switch starter Pack
feature_bullets: Add smart home control to any room: works with Pop home switch starter pack (required/sold separately) to extend smart home control to more rooms
Simple smart home control for the whole family: anyone at home can control multiple smart home devices wirelessly with one press of a switch
Controls smart lighting: turns smart lights on/off to your preset brightness, warmth and Color levels. (Works with philips hue, lifx, insteon, lutron lighting)
Controls SONOS music systems: quickly access preset favorite stations, playlists and volume when your mobile device is out of reach
Multiple mounting options: Stick the switch on a wall, counter top, or take it from room to room for smart home control anywhere around the house
